attributes.action: Take the e-petitions project seriously and take positive action on the issues raised by the many petitions
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned having personally signed many (and varying) petitions and read and considered the governments response(s) to those petitions would like to ask the government to take the e-petitions project seriously and take positive action and be seen to be taking positive action on the issues raised because we are starting to feel that the views on the e-petition site are not being respected.
None of the submitted petitions have changed anything nor has a response said anything positive or to put it plainly for the government to say “yes your right, we will fix that” rather than frankly wishy washy responses straight out of spin doctors mouths that leave us believing that the government spends more time thinking up vaguely plausible excuses rather than fixing the issues that people take the time and trouble to raise through e-petitions.

rejection.details: Please email your comments to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
